Container.Name: plexReport
Container.Description:
This is a Docker for \"plexReport\" - It Creates an email with the latest additions to Plex[br] Forked from original creators page at: https://github.com/bstascavage/plexReport[br][br] [b][span style=\'color: #E80000;\']Directions:[/span][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] : Where the config files will be created.[br][br] After install, run the initial_script.sh:[br] (This only has to be run one time now. Any other docker reinstalls do not require it)[br] -----------------------------------------[br] [b]docker exec -it plexReport ./initial_config.sh[b][br] # Follow Prompts[br] -----------------------------------------[br] You can now edit the email_body.erb and config.yaml with your own settings in your appdata dir[br] To test, run this at the shell:[br] [b]docker exec plexReport plexreport -t[b][br] ==============================================[br] # To schedule the report to occur regulary use the new unRAID 6 cron system:[br][br]
Modify the "plexreport_schedule.cron" with the schedule that you would prefer.[br] This file is located in your docker appdata /config location.[br][br]
Then copy the "plexreport_schedule.cron" to /boot/config/plugins/dynamix.[br] Each time unraid is started it will load your plexreport_schedule.[br] =====================================================================================[br] Please see https://github.com/ninthwalker/plexReport for full config.yaml settings and command line options.[br]
Container.Overview: plexReport generates an email to send to your users with all the latest Plex content
